options.content:
Storage Account Name: ${resource} SKU: ${sku}
Resource Group: ${rg} Blob Endpoint: ${blobendpoint}
Kind: ${kind} File Endpoint: ${fileendpoint}
Location: ${location} Table Endpoint: ${tableendpoint}
Queue Endpoint: ${queueendpoint}

azureLogAnalytics.query:
//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

panels.description: The data comes from Storage metrics. It measures the availability of requests on Storage accounts.

| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

azureResourceGraph.query:
Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project location

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project kind

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(sku.name)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.primaryEndpoints.blob)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.primaryEndpoints.file)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.primaryEndpoints.table)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.storage/storageaccounts'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.primaryEndpoints.queue)
